pageContext.claim: “Last week, my administration also provided historic levels of funding to improve school safety. Through STOP School Violence grants, we are giving local schools and police departments the resources they need to hire more officers, and train more teachers, and better detect and address early warning signs of mental illness before it’s too late.”
pageContext.analysis: The omnibus spending bill shifted $75 billion from an existing school safety program to found the STOP School Violence programs. In other words, these were not new "historic" funds. Plus, as our friends at Factcheck.org reported, funding for school safety programs topped $260 billion as recently as 2000.
